description:
Whether you're on a consumer product (like Gmail, Search, Maps, Chrome, Android) or a business product (Google Ads, AdSense, Google Marketing Platform, Analytics), you take part in a complete marketing experience as you lead every facet of the product's journey. From determining positioning, naming, competitive analysis, feature prioritization and external communications, you help shape the voice of the product and help it grow a consumer base. This means you work with a cross-functional team across Sales, corporate communications, legal, webmasters, product development, engineering and more. In this role, you'll be involved with product marketing strategy from beginning to end.

AppDev is one of the fastest growing business segments within Google’s Ads business and we’re looking for an outstanding Product Marketing Manager to drive exponential growth.

As an AppDev Product Marketing Manager, you’ll be responsible for generating insights from our AppDev ecosystem to inform our ongoing marketing strategy, and subsequently working cross-functionally to execute it. You should be an exceptional strategic thinker who is savvy about Google business products, and how customers see these products in relation to their business. More specifically, you will be designing and executing the growth marketing strategy for Universal App Campaigns, Google’s ads product for the booming apps market. You will work with a cross-functional team across Sales, product, legal, webmasters, regional marketing, and media to bring together teams and resources and drive exponential growth in this exciting segment.

Know the user. Know the magic. Connect the two. At its core, marketing at Google starts with technology and ends with the user, bringing both together in unconventional ways. Our job is to demonstrate how Google's products solve the world's problems--from the everyday to the epic, from the mundane to the monumental. And we approach marketing in a way that only Google can--changing the game, redefining the medium, making the user the priority, and ultimately, letting the technology speak for itself.
eeo: At Google, we don’t just accept difference—we celebrate it, we support it, and we thrive on it for the benefit of our employees, our products and our community. qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience
  • 5 years of partner marketing programs experience at a digital ads (or B2B) company.
  • Experience driving business impact through customer research, insights collection, narrative creation and storytelling.
  • Experience managing numerous projects simultaneously and drive them to completion across a wide range of stakeholders and tight deadlines.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Strong digital marketing background
  • Understanding of the apps market and developer audience.
  • Ability to think strategically, execute effectively, and deliver high-quality work against tight deadlines
  • Skilled communicator with strong written and verbal communication and interpersonal skills, including both professional and casual style of communication
  • Startup attitude and a passion for building new products and businesses
  • Passion for analyzing products, customers and market dynamics. Interest in industry trends and latest marketing techniques
responsibilities:
• Lead the strategy and execution of a Americas AppDev program for end customers and agencies.
  • Build an in-depth knowledge of the needs and challenges of our AppDev audience, and leverage qualitative and quantitative data to generate insights.
  • Innovate on how we tell our story to AppDev customers by proposing new and exciting approaches to conveying our messages via videos, print collateral, etc.
  • Partner with our most successful customers to produce compelling customer success stories which amplify our core growth message.
  • Develop strong internal relationships with Sales, Product and Regional marketing teams to collaborate on marketing initiatives to meet our business goals.
title: Product Marketing Manager, AppDev
